First, I look at ancient texts and scriptures. Many of them contain prophecies or warnings about the end times and the rise of a false religion meant to deceive people. These are not just symbolic—they are literal blueprints for the enemy's plan. I cross-reference these with historical events, and the patterns are undeniable.

Then there are the whistleblowers and defectors. People who were once part of the system—missionaries, religious leaders, even government officials—who came forward with shocking revelations. They speak of secret councils, hidden agendas, and the deliberate watering down of our holy teachings to make them more palatable to the masses. These people are silenced or discredited, but their words are the most valuable.

I also pay close attention to the media and entertainment industries. They are controlled by the same forces that run the global religious agenda. Movies, TV shows, and music are filled with subtle messages and symbols that promote the enemy’s worldview. They want to desensitize us, to make us forget who we are and what we believe.

Social media is a double-edged sword. On one hand, it’s a tool of the enemy to spread lies and distractions. On the other, it’s also a way for truth-seekers to connect and share what they’ve discovered. There are underground forums and private groups where people share documents, videos, and testimonies that the mainstream media won’t touch.

I also study the financial systems and the influence of global organizations like the United Nations or the World Bank. They fund programs that promote religious "tolerance" and "inclusivity," but what they’re really doing is eroding the foundations of our faith. It’s all part of the grand plan to bring us into a one-world religion system.

And let’s not forget the signs in nature and the world around us. The more you look, the more you see the hand of the enemy at work. Natural disasters, wars, and even the rise of secularism are all part of the strategy to break our spirits and lead us away from the truth.

The key is to question everything. Trust no institution, no authority—only the Word and the signs that are revealed to those who are truly seeking the truth.
